com.samysadi.acs.service.staas.sfplacement

Interface SfPlacementPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SfPlacementPolicyAbstract, SfPlacementPolicyBestFit, SfPlacementPolicyFirstFit, SfPlacementPolicyRandomFit, SfPlacementPolicyWorstFit

    public interface SfPlacementPolicy
extends Entity
    Defines methods for selecting a storage among all available storages in all hosts in the cloud when placing a StorageFile.

    This interface also define a method for placing a StorageFile after a storage has been selected, and a method to unplace it after it has been placed (see each method documentation for more information).

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

      • selectStorage

        Storage selectStorage(StorageFile storageFile,
                    List<Host> hosts,
                    List<Host> excludedHosts)
        Selects a host and a storage where to place the given storageFile and returns that storage.

        A storage among all available storages will be selected such that it has enough space to save the given storageFile.

        Among other conditions, the selected storage and its parent host must be in FailureProneEntity.FailureState.OK state. But, the parent host can be in a state other than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON if the cloud provider's power manager allows it to be powered on. In which case, it is left to the placement method to power it on.

        Depending on whether a storage was found or not, a NotificationCodes.SFP_STORAGESELECTION_SUCCESS or NotificationCodes.SFP_STORAGESELECTION_FAILED is thrown.

        Parameters:
        storageFile -
        hosts - possible hosts. May be null in which case, all hosts in the cloud are considered.
        excludedHosts - a list of hosts that should not be selected. May be null.
        Returns:
        the selected storage or null if no storage was found

      • selectStorage

        Storage selectStorage(StorageFile storageFile,
                    List<Host> hosts)
        Alias for selectStorage(StorageFile, List, List) where excluded hosts is null.

      • selectStorage

        Storage selectStorage(StorageFile storageFile)
        Alias for selectStorage(StorageFile, List) where possible hosts is null.

      • canPlaceStorageFile

        boolean canPlaceStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile,
                          Storage storage)
        Returns true if the storageFile can be placed on the given storage.
        Parameters:
        storageFile -
        storage -
        Returns:
        true if the storageFile can be placed on the given storage

      • placeStorageFile

        void placeStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile,
                    Storage storage)
        Takes all actions in order to place the given storageFile on the given storage. When all actions were taken, the storageFile's parent is updated.
        You need to listen to the CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED to know when the placement has ended, as it may not be the case when this method returns.

        The parent host of the given storage may be in another state than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON. If so then this method asks the cloud provider's power manger to power it on.

        You need to check for the return value of canPlaceStorageFile(StorageFile, Storage) to see if the storageFile can be placed on the given storage.
        If you selected the storage using selectStorage(StorageFile) then this method should succeed.

        Parameters:
        storageFile - the StorageFile to place
        storage - the Storage where to place the storageFile
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the following condition(s) are true:
        • the storageFile has already a defined parent;
        • the storageFile cannot be placed on the given storage (ex: if there is not enough space).

      • unplaceStorageFile

        void unplaceStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile)
        Takes all actions in order to unplaces the given storageFile.
        When all actions were taken, the StorageFile's parent is updated (set to null).

        The parent host of the storageFile's Storage should be powered off if the cloud provider's power manger allows it to.

        Parameters:
        storageFile -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the storageFile was not placed using this entity
